SEARCH
Package game.mission

Class AutoSimulation

java.lang.Object
game.mission.Simulation
game.mission.AutoSimulation
public class AutoSimulation extends Simulation
Class responsible for simulating an automatic mission execution. It handles player decisions, enemy movements, and interactions.

  • Constructor Details

    • AutoSimulation

      public AutoSimulation()

  • Method Details

    • autoSimulation

      public static void autoSimulation(Mission mission)
      Executes the auto-simulation of the game based on the given mission. The simulation ends when the mission is completed or the player dies.
      Parameters:
      mission - the mission to be simulated.

    • calculateRoomWeight

      public static double calculateRoomWeight(Mission mission, Room room)
      Calculates the weight of a room based on its conditions. The weight is determined by considering the following factors: - The potential damage from enemies in the room. - The benefits from uncollected items in the room (e.g., health kits). - The presence of enemies in surrounding rooms. Lower weights indicate more desirable rooms, while higher weights indicate greater risk or difficulty.
      Parameters:
      mission - the mission context, which provides details such as the player's state.
      room - the room for which the weight is being calculated.
      Returns:
      the calculated weight of the room.

    • numberOfEnemiesInTheSurrounds

      public static int numberOfEnemiesInTheSurrounds(Mission mission, Room room)
      Counts the total number of enemies in rooms surrounding a given room. This method checks all adjacent rooms (neighbors) of the specified room and counts the enemies present in those rooms. This value is used to increase the weight of the room, as nearby enemies pose an additional risk.
      Parameters:
      mission - the mission context, which provides access to the map and room connections.
      room - the room whose surroundings are being evaluated.
      Returns:
      the total number of enemies in the surrounding rooms.

    • getBestPlayerAction

      public static int getBestPlayerAction(Mission mission)
      Determines the best action for the player to take based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the action to take: 0 - Exit the building. 1 - Move to a new room. 2 - Use a health kit.

    • handleScenario1

      public static void handleScenario1(Mission mission)
      Handles Scenario 1: The player enters a room with enemies and initiates a confrontation. - The player attacks all enemies in the room, dealing damage simultaneously. - If enemies remain alive, they counter-attack the player and remain in the room, while other enemies in the building move randomly.
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and enemies.

    • handleScenario2

      public static void handleScenario2(Mission mission)
      Handles Scenario 2: The player enters a room without enemies. - All Enemies Move Randomly
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and enemies.

    • handleScenario3

      public static void handleScenario3(Mission mission, Enemy enemy)
      Handles Scenario 3: The Enemy enters a room with the Player and initiates a confrontation. - The Enemy attacks the player in the room, dealing damage. - If the player remain alive, they counter-attack the enemy
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and enemies.
      enemy - the enemy that attacks the player

    • handleScenario4

      public static void handleScenario4(Mission mission)
      Handles Scenario 4: The Player uses a health kit. - The Player ends is turn. - All Enemies move Randomly - If the Player does not have items to use the turn is canceled
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and enemies.

    • getBestRoomToMove

      public static Room getBestRoomToMove(Mission mission)
      Determines the best room for the player to move into, minimizing potential damage. Considers the player's current state and mission objectives (target or exit).
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and rooms.
      Returns:
      the next room the player should move to.

    • getBestEntranceToMove

      public static Room getBestEntranceToMove(Mission mission)
      Finds the best entrance for the player to move toward the target room.
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and the map.
      Returns:
      the best entrance/exit room for the player.

    • getBestPathToTarget

      public static ArrayUnorderedList<Room> getBestPathToTarget(Mission mission)
      Calculates the best path for the player to reach the target's room.
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and the target.
      Returns:
      a list of rooms representing the best path to the target.

    • getBestPathToExit

      public static ArrayUnorderedList<Room> getBestPathToExit(Mission mission)
      Calculates the best path for the player to reach the nearest exit room.
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the player and rooms.
      Returns:
      a list of rooms representing the best path to an exit.

    • enemiesRandomMove

      public static void enemiesRandomMove(Mission mission, ArrayUnorderedList<Enemy> enemies)
      Moves enemies randomly throughout the building. Enemies may move multiple times, and if an enemy enters the player's room, a confrontation is triggered.
      Parameters:
      mission - the current mission containing the enemies and rooms.
      enemies - the list of enemies to move.

    • attackSequence

      public static void attackSequence(Player player)
      Handles the attack sequence during a confrontation when the Player has priority. The Player may attack or use an item depending on their life and backpack availability.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player engaging in the confrontation.

    • attackSequence

      public static void attackSequence(Enemy enemy)
      Handles the attack sequence during a confrontation when the Enemy has priority. The Enemy attacks the Player, and the Player retaliates if still alive.
      Parameters:
      enemy - the Enemy engaging in the confrontation.
